examples: The bakery incorporated finely diced fatback into savory pie crusts for flaky results.
The chef instructed us to finely chop the mirepoix vegetables before adding them to the sauce.
Add depth to your creamy soup by including finely chopped chanterelle mushrooms in the recipe.
We enjoy garnishing our pasta dishes with a pinch of finely chopped sage.
I sprinkled some finely chopped fat hen over my omelet.
words.defineEn: in a way that is impressive or shows skill
words.defineVi: theo cách ấn tượng hoặc thể hiện kỹ năng

examples: The same thing actually applies internationally.
Meanwhile, those three films grossed $2.3 billion in North America and $2.5 billion internationally.
Internationally, Taco Bell has nearly 500 stores across almost 30 countries.
So there's still a lot of room for growth for them internationally.
So, I worry, internationally, what mischief he might cause.
words.defineEn: relating to or among two or more countries
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc giữa hai hoặc nhiều quốc gia

examples: Rightly we boast.
And the Internet, rightly, went wild.
And so people are rightly offended.
They're rightly uncertain about what American policy is going to be.
And so the Biden administration now is rightly recognizing that we need to use this technology.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is correct, exact, or accurate
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là chính xác, chính xác, hoặc chính xác

examples: The area is intensely guarded.
The brick and mortar video game market is intensely competitive.
After the debacle in Iowa, national attention has focused even more intensely on New Hampshire as the first real clean test of political momentum in this race.
, they're intensely concerned that the president has essentially now added to an obstruction case.
You can even feel intensely turned off from your partners touch.
words.defineEn: to a very great or extreme extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ hoặc mức độ rất lớn hoặc cực đoan

examples: The decorations were specially designed for the wedding reception.
He was specially awarded for his exceptional contributions to the organization.
A snake's organs are specially adapted to run along the inside of its body.
It was specially designed to look at some of the bigger things in the universe like clusters of galaxies.
The electrodes were specially designed to deliver small electrical currents to different regions of the visual cortex, activating the brain cells there.
words.defineEn: for a specific purpose, reason, person, etc.
words.defineVi: cho một mục đích cụ thể, lý do, người, vv

examples: The roads were violently twisted.
For a week in September of 2005, the ground shook violently.
violently divided among religious factions for several generations.
In response, the police are cracking down violently, with the bloodiest days this past weekend.
They acted too soon and too violently.
words.defineEn: in a forceful manner that is intended to cause harm
words.defineVi: trong một cách mạnh mẽ mà là nhằm gây hại

examples: Cast-iron pans are exceptionally versatile.
Our species is exceptionally social.
The F-35 has sold exceptionally well.
So, Serena Williams does exceptionally well.
I am exceptionally comfortable.
words.defineEn: to a degree greater than usual
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hơn bình thường

examples: The friction force is pointing inward.
And the force is directed inwards toward the center of that circle.
It's inward.
And then move the fingers inward along the pipe.
So my acceleration vector is going to be inward.
words.defineEn: toward the center or inside of something
words.defineVi: về phía trung tâm hoặc bên trong của một cái gì đó

examples: Freshly baked chocolate chip cookies are even more delicious with a touch of sugar.
I poured a glass of cold milk to accompany my freshly baked chocolate chip cookies.
The aroma of paprika filled the air as it was sprinkled on the freshly baked bread.
The scent of bergamot orange fills the air as I zest it over my freshly baked lemon bars.
I couldn't resist buying a bag of freshly roasted peanuts from the street vendor.
words.defineEn: recently done or made
words.defineVi: gần đây đã thực hiện hoặc thực hiện

examples: Anyhow, the binding of the viral RNA to these DNA probes creates a change in the electrical charge of the molecules.
Anyhow, they live practically everywhere.
anyhow, so my hearing loss is going to differ from Quinten's or anybody else.
So, anyhow, I met him that way.
And it's so cheap anyhow.
words.defineEn: used when ending a conversation, or changing, or returning to a subject
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi kết thúc cuộc trò chuyện hoặc thay đổi hoặc quay lại chủ đề

examples: The unique flavor of physalis pairs wonderfully with dark chocolate in desserts.
He did well, wonderfully well.
Inside, it is wonderfully cool.
And you did it so wonderfully.
Maddie is so wonderfully quiet.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is unusually good
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ đó là tốt bất thường

examples: It would be overegging the pudding to describe the system as universally popular.
In ten years he has become part of the furniture of English life, his place on the stage firmly fixed and universally respected.
Certain emotions do certain things to people’s faces, almost universally.
Moral facts apply as universally and as constantly as gravity or the speed of light.
It's also universally common, not just on our planet but in our galaxy and our universe.
words.defineEn: to an extent that involves everyone
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ liên quan đến tất cả mọi người

examples: The interior of the truck is just unbelievably great.
From the outside, a neutron star is unbelievably extreme.
That's unbelievably powerful tool.
No matter what form phytoplankton take, they are unbelievably important to all life on Earth.
So these are unbelievably energetic events.
words.defineEn: to a large extent
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn

examples: FRED DE SAM LAZARO: Just casually, somebody you had never known before.
"He's just casually cleaning his Tesla coil."
Lions, for example, will casually eat their dead companions rather than pass up some easy calories.
Oh look, I am just casually and gracefully checking the time on my watch.
Maybe you're dating someone casually, or you're in a committed relationship, or you're married.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is informal and relaxed
words.defineVi: một cách không chính thức và thoải mái

examples: To Thomas, her laugh sounded horribly like a growl.
This game was built horribly.
Good Lord, your dad has horribly ugly ears!
And it was horribly damaging?
Even though I'm horribly wrong.
words.defineEn: in an extremely bad or terrible way
words.defineVi: trong một cách cực kỳ xấu hoặc khủng khiếp

examples: In front of them the valley dropped sharply away from the road.
She turned the wheel sharply to the left.
The road bends sharply to the left just ahead, so be prepared to slow down.
NASDAQ is down sharply again and its European counterparts are still in the doldrums.
Stockholders took it on the chin yesterday as markets fell sharply.
words.defineEn: with a sudden and significant change; dramatically
words.defineVi: với một sự thay đổi đột ngột và đáng kể; đáng kể

examples: The trial was swiftly brought to an end.
At the same time, Maduro's opposition was swiftly gaining strength.
Inside the brain, the bacteria swiftly infect the meninges.
Moving swiftly on.
The ant is swiftly trapped in this goo.
words.defineEn: in a quick or immediate way
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng hoặc ngay lập tức

examples: He invested wisely and became incredibly rich.
It's important to manage your time wisely.
My grandfather often warned that shrouds have no pockets, encouraging me to spend wisely and value experiences over possessions.
Investing your money wisely.
Choose wisely.
words.defineEn: in a manner that reflects wisdom, sound judgment, and experience
words.defineVi: theo cách phản ánh sự khôn ngoan, phán đoán hợp lý và kinh nghiệm

examples: Airport security was extra tight in the wake of yesterday's bomb attacks.
They run extra trains during the rush hour.
Be extra careful with this one.
She turned her singing talent into extra money.
I packed an extra jacket for the camping trip.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is greater or more than usual
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ lớn hơn hoặc nhiều hơn bình thường

examples: When a company is that large often times the right doesn't know what the left hand is doing and vice versa.
The inverse of the period of a wave is its frequency, vice versa.
Derivative of sine is cosine, and vice versa.
A rise in prices is effectively the exact same thing as a cut in wages, and vice versa.
And then vice versa if you were playing something like Cyberpunk 2077 for whatever reason.
words.defineEn: with the order or relations reversed
words.defineVi: với thứ tự hoặc quan hệ đảo ngược

examples: What are some powerful methods to break someone psychologically?
Many people who have been divorced have been through the mill psychologically.

People, psychologically, like to see detail.
Psychologically, I have a problem with this.
words.defineEn: in a way that is related to someone's mind or emotions
words.defineVi: theo cách có liên quan đến tâm trí hoặc cảm xúc của ai đó

examples: Both of these are pretty loosely enforced, though.
Now, I've used the term coordinates fairly loosely in the past.
They were loosely linked by language and spiritual belief but lacked centralized control.
The space is a big one, loosely enveloping any tech company with a financial services flair.
Although in the case of Beloved, I suppose one uses the term 'fun' loosely.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is not tightly or firmly held or attached
words.defineVi: theo cách không được giữ hoặc gắn chặt hoặc chắc chắn

examples: The mega-mall was immensely profitable.
Having Amazon here would have helped immensely.
I appreciate it immensely, thank you.
And it hurt immensely the media’s cause of trying to destroy and discredit the Tea Party, that they were constantly smeared and lied about.
The death of his brother affected him immensely, as the violent death of anyone's brother would.
words.defineEn: to a very great degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ rất tuyệt vời

examples: We all left the room silently.
We all left the room silently.
She used to go silently in and out of the room with a plate of food or a glass of beer.
So in a 1982 study, researchers told participants to silently read tongue twisters.
That way, they can silently stalk their prey until they’re close enough to pounce.
words.defineEn: without speaking or making any sound
words.defineVi: mà không nói hoặc làm cho bất kỳ âm thanh

examples: The Calgary Stampede is a famous rodeo and festival held annually in Alberta, Canada.
France is one of the most visited countries in the world, attracting millions of tourists annually.
This facility processes up to a million tons of waste annually.
Research like Cohen's can save lives and billions annually.
In 1976, the industry was already making $25 billion annually.
words.defineEn: once in a year; yearly
words.defineVi: một lần trong năm; hàng năm
